name: dirgen
description:
Generate a set of uniformly distributed directions using a bipolar electrostatic repulsion model.

Directions are distributed by analogy to an electrostatic repulsion system, with each direction corresponding to a single electrostatic charge (for -unipolar), or a pair of diametrically opposed charges (for the default bipolar case). The energy of the system is determined based on the Coulomb repulsion, which assumes the form 1/r^power, where r is the distance between any pair of charges, and p is the power assumed for the repulsion law (default: 1). The minimum energy state is obtained by gradient descent.

References:

Jones, D.; Horsfield, M. & Simmons, A. Optimal strategies for measuring diffusion in anisotropic systems by magnetic resonance imaging. Magnetic Resonance in Medicine, 1999, 42: 515-525

Papadakis, N. G.; Murrills, C. D.; Hall, L. D.; Huang, C. L.-H. & Adrian Carpenter, T. Minimal gradient encoding for robust estimation of diffusion anisotropy. Magnetic Resonance Imaging, 2000, 18: 671-679
author: J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com)

inputs.name: ndir
inputs.description: the number of directions to generate.

inputs.name: dirs
inputs.description: the text file to write the directions to, as [ az el ] pairs.

inputs.name: power
inputs.description: specify exponent to use for repulsion power law (default: 1). This must be a power of 2 (i.e. 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, ...).

inputs.name: niter
inputs.description: specify the maximum number of iterations to perform (default: 10000).

inputs.name: restarts
inputs.description: specify the number of restarts to perform (default: 10).

inputs.name: unipolar
inputs.description: optimise assuming a unipolar electrostatic repulsion model rather than the bipolar model normally assumed in DWI

inputs.name: cartesian
inputs.description: Output the directions in Cartesian coordinates [x y z] instead of [az el].

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
